children.comment: Everything in Dart is an [Object].
children.name: Object

children.comment:
The equality operator.

The default behavior for all [Object]s is to return true if and
only if [:this:] and [other] are the same object.

If a subclass overrides the equality operator it should override
the [hashCode] method as well to maintain consistency.
Returns a string representation of this object.
children.name: toString

children.comment:
[noSuchMethod] is invoked when users invoke a non-existant method
on an object. The name of the method and the arguments of the
invocation are passed to [noSuchMethod] in an [Invocation].
If [noSuchMethod] returns a value, that value becomes the result of
the original invocation.

The default behavior of [noSuchMethod] is to throw a
[noSuchMethodError].
children.name: noSuchMethod

children.comment:
Get a hash code for this object.

All objects have hash codes. Hash codes are guaranteed to be the
same for objects that are equal when compared using the equality
operator [:==:]. Other than that there are no guarantees about
the hash codes. They will not be consistent between runs and
there are no distribution guarantees.

If a subclass overrides [hashCode] it should override the
equality operator as well to maintain consistency.
children.name: hashCode

children.comment: A representation of the runtime type of the object.
children.name: runtimeType

children.comment:
Creates a new [Object] instance.

[Object] instances have no meaningful state, and are only useful
through their identity. An [Object] instance is equal to itself
only.
children.name: Object

name: package:unittest/unittest.dart

children.comment: Disable a test by ID.
children.name: disableTest

children.comment: Enable a test by ID.
children.name: enableTest

children.comment: Enable/disable a test by ID.
children.name: _setTestEnabledState

children.comment: Select a solo test by ID.
children.name: setSoloTest

children.comment: Lazily initializes the test library if not already initialized.
children.name: ensureInitialized

children.comment: Publish results on the page and notify controller.
children.name: _completeTests

children.comment:
Runs a batch of tests, yielding whenever an asynchronous test starts
running. Tests will resume executing when such asynchronous test calls
[done] or if it fails with an exception.
children.name: _nextBatch

children.comment: Registers that an exception was caught for the current test.
children.name: _registerException

children.comment: Registers that an exception was caught for the current test.
children.name: registerException

children.comment:
Run [tryBody] guarded in a try-catch block. If an exception is thrown, it is
passed to the corresponding test.

The value returned by [tryBody] (if any) is returned by [guardAsync].
children.name: guardAsync

children.comment: Runs all queued tests, one at a time.
children.name: runTests

children.comment:
Filter the tests. [testFilter] can be a [RegExp], a [String] or a
predicate function. This is different to enabling/disabling tests
in that it removes the tests completely.
children.name: filterTests

children.comment:
Utility function that can be used to notify the test framework that an
 error was caught outside of this library.
children.name: _reportTestError

children.comment: Advance to the next test case.
children.name: _nextTestCase

children.comment:
Register a [tearDown] function for a test [group]. This function will
be called after each test in the group is run. Note that if groups
are nested only the most locally scoped [teardownTest] function will be run.
[setUp] and [tearDown] should be called within the [group] before any
calls to [test]. The [teardownTest] function can be asynchronous; in this
case it must return a [Future].
children.name: tearDown

children.comment:
Register a [setUp] function for a test [group]. This function will
be called before each test in the group is run.
[setUp] and [tearDown] should be called within the [group] before any
calls to [test]. The [setupTest] function can be asynchronous; in this
case it must return a [Future].
children.name: setUp

children.comment:
Creates a new named group of tests. Calls to group() or test() within the
body of the function passed to this will inherit this group's description.
children.name: group

children.comment: Like [protectAsync0] but [callback] should take 2 positional arguments.
children.name: protectAsync2

children.comment: Like [protectAsync0] but [callback] should take 1 positional argument.
children.name: protectAsync1

children.comment:
Wraps the [callback] in a new function and returns that function. The new
function will be able to handle exceptions by directing them to the correct
test. This is thus similar to expectAsync0. Use it to wrap any callbacks that
might optionally be called but may never be called during the test.
[callback] should take 0 positional arguments (named arguments are not
supported). [id] can be used to identify the callback in error
messages (for example if it is called after the test case is complete).
children.name: protectAsync0

children.comment: Like [expectAsyncUntil0] but [callback] should take 2 positional arguments.
children.name: expectAsyncUntil2

children.comment: Like [expectAsyncUntil0] but [callback] should take 1 positional argument.
children.name: expectAsyncUntil1

children.comment:
Indicate that [callback] is expected to be called until [isDone] returns
true. The unittest framework check [isDone] after each callback and only
when it returns true will it continue with the following test. Using
[expectAsyncUntil0] will also ensure that errors that occur within
[callback] are tracked and reported. [callback] should take 0 positional
arguments (named arguments are not supported). [id] can be used to
identify the callback in error messages (for example if it is called
after the test case is complete).
children.name: expectAsyncUntil0

children.comment: Like [expectAsync0] but [callback] should take 2 positional arguments.
children.name: expectAsync2

children.comment: Like [expectAsync0] but [callback] should take 1 positional argument.
children.name: expectAsync1

children.comment:
Indicate that [callback] is expected to be called a [count] number of times
(by default 1). The unittest framework will wait for the callback to run the
specified [count] times before it continues with the following test.  Using
[expectAsync0] will also ensure that errors that occur within [callback] are
tracked and reported. [callback] should take 0 positional arguments (named
arguments are not supported). [id] can be used to provide more
descriptive error messages if the callback is called more often than
expected. [max] can be used to specify an upper bound on the number of
calls; if this is exceeded the test will fail (or be marked as in error if
it was already complete). A value of 0 for [max] (the default) will set
the upper bound to the same value as [count]; i.e. the callback should be
called exactly [count] times. A value of -1 for [max] will mean no upper
bound.
children.name: expectAsync0

children.comment:
Creates a new test case with the given description and body. The
description will include the descriptions of any surrounding group()
calls.

"solo_" means that this will be the only test that is run. All other tests
will be skipped. This is a convenience function to let you quickly isolate
a single test by adding "solo_" before it to temporarily disable all other
tests.
children.name: solo_test

children.comment:
Creates a new test case with the given description and body. The
description will include the descriptions of any surrounding group()
calls.
children.name: test

children.comment: [TestCase] currently being executed.
children.name: currentTestCase

children.comment:
Can be called by tests to log status. Tests should use this
instead of [print].
children.name: logMessage

children.comment:
Sets the [Configuration] used by the unittest library.

Throws a [StateError] if there is an existing, incompatible value.
children.name: unittestConfiguration=

children.comment: [Configuration] used by the unittest library.
children.name: unittestConfiguration

children.comment: [TestCase] currently being executed.
children.name: currentTestCase

children.comment: [Configuration] used by the unittest library.
children.name: unittestConfiguration

children.comment:
A map that can be used to communicate state between a test driver
or main() function and the tests, particularly when these two
are otherwise independent. For example, a test driver that starts
an HTTP server and then runs tests that access that server could use
this as a way of communicating the server port to the tests.
children.name: testState

children.comment: If set, then all other test cases will be ignored.
children.name: _soloTest

children.comment: Test case result strings.
children.name: PASS

children.comment: Whether the framework is in an initialized state.
children.name: _initialized

children.comment: Tests executed in this suite.
children.name: testCases

children.comment: Separator used between group names and test names.
children.name: groupSep

children.comment:
Represents the state for an individual unit test.

Create by calling [test] or [solo_test].
children.name: TestCase

children.comment:
Perform any associated [_setUp] function and run the test. Returns
a [Future] that can be used to schedule the next test. If the test runs
to completion synchronously, or is disabled, null is returned, to
tell unittest to schedule the next test immediately.
children.name: _run

children.comment: Error or failure message.
children.name: message

children.comment: One of [PASS], [FAIL], [ERROR], or [null] if the test hasn't run yet.
children.name: result

children.comment: Stack trace associated with this test, or [null] if it succeeded.
children.name: stackTrace

children.comment: Identifier for this test.
children.name: id

children.comment: A description of what the test is specifying.
children.name: description

children.comment: The setup function to call before the test, if any.
children.name: setUp

children.comment: The teardown function to call after the test, if any.
children.name: tearDown

children.comment: The body of the test case.
children.name: testFunction

children.comment:
Remaining number of callbacks functions that must reach a 'done' state
to wait for before the test completes.
children.name: _callbackFunctionsOutstanding

children.comment: The group (or groups) under which this test is running.
children.name: currentGroup

children.comment:
Hooks to configure the unittest library for different platforms. This class
implements the API in a platform-independent way. Tests that want to take
advantage of the platform can create a subclass and override methods from
this class.
children.name: Configuration

children.comment:
Called as soon as the unittest framework becomes initialized. This is done
even before tests are added to the test framework. It might be used to
determine/debug errors that occur before the test harness starts executing.
It is also used to tell the vm or browser that tests are going to be run
asynchronously and that the process should wait until they are done.
children.name: onInit

children.comment: Called as soon as the unittest framework starts running.
children.name: onStart

children.comment:
Called when each test starts. Useful to show intermediate progress on
a test suite.
children.name: onTestStart

children.comment:
Called when each test is first completed. Useful to show intermediate
progress on a test suite.
children.name: onTestResult

children.comment:
Called when an already completed test changes state; for example a test
that was marked as passing may later be marked as being in error because
it still had callbacks being invoked.
children.name: onTestResultChanged

children.comment:
Handles the logging of messages by a test case. The default in
this base configuration is to call print();
children.name: onLogMessage

children.comment:
Called with the result of all test cases. The default implementation prints
the result summary using the built-in [print] command. Browser tests
commonly override this to reformat the output.

When [uncaughtError] is not null, it contains an error that occured outside
of tests (e.g. setting up the test).
children.name: onSummary

children.comment:
Called when the unittest framework is done running. [success] indicates
whether all tests passed successfully.
children.name: onDone

children.comment: Handle errors that happen outside the tests.
children.name: handleExternalError

children.comment:
Subclasses can override this with something useful for diagnostics.
Particularly useful in cases where we have parent/child configurations
such as layout tests.
children.name: name

children.comment:
If true, then tests are started automatically (otherwise [runTests]
must be called explicitly after the tests are set up.
children.name: autoStart

children.comment: Signature for a test function.
children.name: TestFunction

children.comment: Simulates spread arguments using named arguments.
children.name: _SpreadArgsHelper

children.comment: Sentinel value for [_SpreadArgsHelper].
children.name: _Sentinel

children.comment:
Setup and teardown functions for a group and its parents, the latter
for chaining.
children.name: GroupContext

children.comment: Description text of the current test group.
children.name: _name

children.comment: Setup function called before each test in a group.
children.name: _testSetup

children.comment: Teardown function called after each test in a group.
children.name: _testTeardown
